resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/103504</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>103504</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1805973950</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Physics Games: Transistor</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Physik-Spiele: Transistor</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Jeux de Physique : Transistor</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Jogos Da Física: Transistor</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Giochi Di Fisica: Transistore</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Παιχνίδια φυσικής: Κρυσταλλολυχνία</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Juegos De la Física: Transistor</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Play a game and find out about a Nobel Prize awarded discovery or work! Shockley, Bardeen and Brattain, the men behind the transistor, were awarded the 1956 Nobel Prize in Physics. Today, transistors are found in virtually every electronic device.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Science and Technology</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Spielen Sie ein Spiel und finden Sie über eine 
zugesprochene Entdeckung oder eine Arbeit des Nobelpreises heraus! 
Shockley, Bardeen und Brattain, die Männer hinter dem 
Transistor, wurden den Nobelpreis 1956 in der Physik zugesprochen. 
Heute werden Transistoren in praktisch jeder elektronischen 
Einheit gefunden.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Jouez un jeu et découvrez au sujet d'une 
découverte ou d'un travail attribuée de prix Nobel ! Shockley,
Bardeen et Brattain, les hommes derrière le transistor, ont été 
attribués le prix 1956 Nobel dans la physique. Aujourd'hui, des
transistors sont trouvés dans pratiquement chaque dispositif 
électronique.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Jogue um jogo e encontre-o para fora sobre uma 
descoberta ou um trabalho concedido do prêmio de nobel! 
Shockley, Bardeen e Brattain, homens atrás do transistor, foram
concedidos o prêmio 1956 de nobel na física. Hoje, os 
transistor são encontrados em virtualmente cada dispositivo 
eletrônico.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Gioc un gioco e scopra circa una scoperta o un 
lavoro ricevuta del premio Nobel! Shockley, Bardeen e Brattain, 
gli uomini dietro il transistore, hanno ricevuto il premio 1956 Nobel 
nella fisica. Oggi, i transistori sono trovati in virtualmente 
ogni dispositivo elettronico.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Παίξτε ένα παιχνίδι και ανακαλύψτε για μια 
απονεμημένη βραβείο ανακάλυψη ή μια εργασία Νόμπελ! Το 
Shockley, Bardeen και Brattain, τα άτομα πίσω από την 
κρυσταλλολυχνία, απονεμήθηκαν το βραβείο Νόμπελ του 1956 στη 
φυσική. Σήμερα, οι κρυσταλλολυχνίες βρίσκονται σε 
ουσιαστικά κάθε ηλεκτρονική συσκευή.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">¡Juegue un juego y descubra sobre un 
descubrimiento o un trabajo concedido del premio Nobel! 
Shockley, Bardeen y Brattain, los hombres detrás del 
transistor, fueron concedidos el premio 1956 Nobel en la física. 
Hoy, los transistores se encuentran en virtualmente cada 
dispositivo electrónico.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wissenschaft und Technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La Science et technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciência e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienza e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Επιστήμη και τεχνολογία</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencia y tecnología</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1805973950</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>103504</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/physics-games-transistor</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
